review:
3人の操作キャラクターを切り替えて戦うアクションRPG。スキルレベル上げ込みでクリアまで約30時間。
元のPSP版が2009年発売とのことで一昔前になります。このPC版ではHD化によってイラストやUIは綺麗になっていますが、テクスチャの解像度は低いままで最初は気になるかもしれません。
それでも[b]アクションは今でも通用する出来[/b]だと思います。スピーディでプレイヤーの腕がある程度試される戦闘と、たくさんノリの良い曲があります。

[h1]戦闘バランス・システム[/h1]
雑魚戦は適切な武器属性に切り替えながらサクサク。ボス戦は難易度Normalでも想像していたより手強いです。最初のボスで容赦ないHPを前にして気持ちを引き締めたくらいに。無闇にスキルを連発すれば勝てるものではなく、常に立ち回りを意識する必要があります。回復アイテムの所持数制限が厳しめでごり押しは難しいでしょう。
それが本作の良い所でもあります。操作キャラは遅延や待ち時間無くキビキビと動かせて操作性は抜群。レベルを上げて出直すか、何度か挑めばすんなり突破できるバランスです。敵の攻撃パターンを見極めて攻める戦闘は程よい緊張感がありました。

戦闘での注意点を1つ言うと、「フラッシュガード」後は無敵が発生しません。敵の多段ヒット技ではガードが成功しても直後にダメージを受けてしまうため、ガード連打か即座に回避をしなければいけません。少しでも無敵時間があればさらに戦闘が快適だったかなと。
またフラッシュガードは初期設定では2つのボタン同時押しになっていて咄嗟に出しづらい。[b]キーコンフィグで同じ1つのボタンに割り当てると使いやすく[/b]なります。

操作する加入キャラは物語の進行に合わせてコロコロ変わります。育てた能力は引き継がれていて安心して使えましたし、キャラ毎に異なる攻撃スキルで変わる度に新鮮味がありました。
後半には仲間が揃って好きな組み合わせでPTが組めるようになります。メンバーやスキルを入れ替えるのも楽しみの一つでしたが、人によっては手間に感じるかも。
味方のAIは賢く、勝手に突っ込んで自滅する場面はほぼ無し。ただ遠距離攻撃を主体にしているとプレイヤー側に駆け寄ってきてしまい、敵を攻撃してくれない場面がたまにありました。

[h1]物語・楽曲[/h1]
RPGとしてはよくあるお話で、各地を巡って真実を解き明かしラストバトルへ……という流れ。展開が後の『Ys VIII』と重なる部分がちらほらあったため、逆にシリーズ未プレイのほうが純粋に読み進められるかもしれません（発売順的には逆ですが）。
しかし流れがシンプルな故に目的は分かりやすく、意外性ありの最後にはぐっと来るところもあって総合的には悪くありませんでした。後は仲間として一緒に戦うのだからクエスト等で各キャラの掘り下げなんかがあれば。

楽曲もアクションに負けず劣らず聴きごたえがあります。最初の平原に出たところで既に勢いに圧倒され、ボス戦、そしてラストダンジョンに至るまでギターや弦楽器の迫力が凄まじい。イベントシーンでは悲壮感ある旋律でしっとりと、緩急があって戦闘曲以外も心に残りました。

[h1]その他[/h1]
今作はクリア後に解禁されるオマケ（2周目、ボスラッシュ）がありません。私は別シリーズで「ボスラッシュ」を遊ぶのに本編以上に時間を費やしたこともあって、無いのが惜しまれます。

気になった所：
[list]
[*]ダッシュするには回避ボタンを連打することに
[*]せっかく7人もいるだから主人公もPTから外せれば
[*]アクセサリー枠が1つだと固定になりがち
[*]町の人と話しそびれてクエストを逃す
[/list]
これらは些細な事であまり影響はありませんが一応。この辺りを考えると後の作品ではきちんと改善されているのが分かります。

[h1]まとめ[/h1]
画質はイマイチですがそれを理由に敬遠するのは勿体ない作品です。アクションや楽曲からは古さを感じさせません。クリアまでそれほど時間はかからず手をつけやすいですし、このプレイ時間にしては堅実で濃い内容が詰まっています。サントラも買っちゃいました。
心残りなのはクリア後に追加要素が無い事ぐらいです。

最後に個人的な感想を。
スキルレベルを上げるのにラストダンジョンのフロアをぐるぐる回りながらひたすら敵を倒す作業をしていた時、昔遊んでいたネットゲームの感覚が蘇ってきてそれだけでめちゃくちゃ懐かしくて最高でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198110554607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1610595800}
review:
I'm sorry. I just don't see it.

I've now played every Ys game that has been released stateside.  Of that list, I absolutely ADORE Ys VIII and think it's some of the overall greatest fun of the series.  Yet many Ys fans can't stand VIII, and I think I know why.

At its core, Ys toes the line between being a dungeon crawler and a platformer.  I can't stand either genre.  Ys VIII on the other hand is as traditional as it gets - an Action RPG in the purest sense, largely outdoors (but you ARE going through dungeons), and there are puzzles, but none that waste your time or frustrate you.  

Ys SEVEN took what Napishtim was trying to do (the three weapon system) and became the first to actually introduce the concept of a party (Celceta would later significantly improve the implementation, where Ys VIII nearly perfects it).  The problem is the forced way the party system is implemented; more on that later.

If you want to play through the series then yes, it's recommended.  It's definitely recommended over the "Adol only" ones if you're a fan of what RPGs should be - which is a party of people doing whatever it is they need to do.  But as a standalone game?  I would NEVER suggest this to anyone.  Play Ys VIII and pretend like this didn't exist if all you want is a new RPG to play and don't care about the series.

[h1]What I Liked[/h1]

✅ Music is simply excellent.
✅ There's not too much crazy complexity with the battle engine or controls.
✅ Some cutscenes - not many though, but at least there are some.
✅ I didn't feel any bosses were explicitly cheesy.


[h1]What I Didn't Like[/h1]

⛔ The STORY.  Ugh - if there's one thing I can't stand, it's when a game starts off with a very interesting premise, does a very good plot twist, then totally ***t's the bed for the climax/end game.  I can't STAND IT!  And that's exactly happens here.

⛔ Every single dungeon is annoying.  Every.  Single.  One.  Puzzles aren't crazy, but the dungeons are LONG and have a lot of "go all the way over here to hit a switch and then go all the way back" or "get knocked down to this floor, ooo a switch, got to hit that, go back up to find some piece you need to stop water" or waiting for spinning things that go  SLOOOOOW.  It's just annoying dungeon crawling - a hallmark of the older series, and just as bad here as it was in Felghana.

⛔ You'll end up with quite a few characters along the way.  The problem, as is the case with other games that do this, is that the vast majority of them aren't needed and hardly used - but if you don't use them and/or don't power them up, you'll regret it, because there's a battle where they'll be forced on you (I can't stand this either).  The game doesn't go out of its way to really make you care about these characters vs. the "main ones".

⛔ No voice acting.  At all.  Napishtim on PS2 had it and it helps when it comes to emotional attachment with the characters.  That's part of the problem here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056063859', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1041, 'last_played': 1610374091}
review:
Very good game with a charming 3D artsyle and amazing combat. Has a nice simple story with great characters. After playing through all of the old games (Origins, Felghana, Napishtim) and not really seeing the appeal, Seven is the first Ys game to really hook me. 

Plays a lot like the 3D Zelda games, but with levels and gear. The gameplay loop is the same. Explore dungeon, find item/solve puzzle, kill boss, move on to next dungeon. The boss fights are all really fun, with one exception. The final boss. It's absolute garbage because [spoiler] You are forced to use every character, but because skills in this game level up based on how many times you use them, most of the characters except for Adol+2 others will be severely underpowered and not at all fit to be fighting a final boss. The Adol 1v1 was great but the first 2 stages were way harder than they needed to be [/spoiler]

The story is simple enough. Standard JRPG stuff. The characters are all really nice, and if you're a fan of Falcoms Legend of Heroes series, you'll recognize the detail put into even the most minor NPCs. NPC dialogue will change based on events that happen during the story, so it's worth it to check in on the various towns from time to time to see whats going on.

If you're a fan of the traditional 3D Zelda games, or Falcoms Legend of Heroes series, I'd recommend giving this a try.

review:
Ys is a series for connoisseurs for excellent video games.  Imagine the perfect 90s Japanese Action RPG.  On point action, interesting bosses, fun grinding, cool characters, and an engaging story.  Ys games always have an amazing soundtrack and Seven might be my favorite of the whole series.  Its full on synthetic power-metal interspersed with slamming classic 8-bit style horror vacua beats that fully use the modern synth the way these same magicians used a Commodore 64 back in the day.

For those new to Ys, Seven might be an odd starting point.  The game was originally designed for a portable system and the graphics are about halfway converted to modern HDMI.  It also takes about an hour to get going which is a much easier slog if you already know the characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982748375', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1606268897}
review:
tl;dr conclusion at the top: Ys Seven is one of the better games in the series, approachable and easy to get into with great music to back it up. Just remember that this is a port of an 11 year old PSP game at the end of the day and you can have some fun with this one. This game took me approximately 21 hours to beat on Normal, not quite 100% as I missed one sidequest (dang it) and didn't feel like grinding crafting materials for another.

After getting Ys 8 on sale a little while ago and loving it, it reminded me of my soft spot for the series. And so I embarked on my quest to complete every Ys game in the series, and that quest comes to an end with Ys Seven until next year's Monstum Nox (in NA at least).

Seven is chronologically the furthest along in the series until 9 releases, and our boy Adol "Shipwreck" Christin has finally made it to Altago after this place being teased/foreshadowed in a handful of the preceding games. Amazingly his boat makes it to port just fine, and Adol never once washes up on shore and/or loses his memory in this game. The plot starts off as a by-the-numbers adventure affair, but takes an interesting turn about 2/3 of the way in that I won't spoil in a review. Suffice to say it raises the stakes pretty significantly. The final handful of boss fights through the last 1/3rd are a blast and easily some of the best in the series in design and creativity.

Graphically this game looks like a PSP game. Probably because it is a PSP game from over a decade ago. That said I have no problems here. I found the low-poly character models charming (as opposed to the ugly low-poly work in Oath/Ark), the world is constructed with care, and the color palletes are bright and colorful. It adds up to a very retro feel, and I'm sure any old toaster still running can probably run this game. Don't expect a ton of graphical options here, but then again there's really not much need for them. Other than some wince-worthy low-res textures used in a few places - i.e. bottles on the table at the tavern and similar - it all looks fine when you consider where it's coming from and the age of it.

Gameplay here is closest to Celceta which came out a few years after Seven. Like that, and 8, this game uses the slash/pierce/blunt trifecta of damage types with various enemies being strong or weak to each. Unlike 8, but like Celceta, this game does not have the Break system so the only way for your teammates to do damage to things that are strong against them is to stun the enemy. This leads to some problems that I didn't notice as much in Celceta I think because of the difference in how Seven is balanced. First problem: You often can't stun an enemy because you'll have swapped control to a strong character to deal with it and it dies too fast. This is typical of the smaller mobs. Secondly: Each enemy type has different stun recovery rates when you do knock them over, some of which recover so fast the AI controlled teammates will often only get one or two hits in before they un-stagger themselves. Third: This game actually has a very large cast of party members, but even though there are certain bonuses on doubling up a particular damage type every dungeon you delve always throws a gauntlet of enemies of each type, and you can never remove Adol (unlike the two later games) so there's very little reason to not just keep one of each damage type. To mitigate this there are weapons that characters can equip that change their damage types but you won't see these until around mid-game, nor are any of them suitable for the final end-game areas. It's not the end of the world or anything, just know that your party will be pretty static and you're probably just going to pick the two backups you like best and stuff them with Adol the whole time which is precisely what I did.

If Flash Step is in this game you could've fooled me since I never triggered it. But Flash Guard is here again (though admittedly this was probably the first game that had it) granting a brief window of guaranteed crits if you block at the last second. I feel like this isn't very useful in this game though. The aforementioned window is VERY short, maybe 2 hits or 3 if you're lucky. The other downside is tied to why guarding in general is just a bit dumb in this game. There's no hit-stun or hit-decay of any kind which can not only lead to being juggled mercilessly with no way get out of it, but even if you do Flash Guard an enemy you're usually still going to get punched in the face and knocked down since most enemy attacks from larger monsters hit multiple times or are combos. Basically it's just kind of cheap sometimes. You're better off just going full Sanic and rolling which has very generous i-frames.

Speaking of, unlike Celceta which gives you an item that lets you go real fast out, and Ys 8 which has a general sprint function out of the box, there is none of that here. The only way to get around quickly is to roll around at the speed of sound. Make sure you bind it on a button that won't leave you with tired fingers.

Music is phenomenal in this episode. It's up there with 8 for me. Segram Desert is definitely a standout track, and the boss themes in the latter 1/3rd of the game are all stellar. Definitely some of Falcom JDK's best stuff.

Technical issues: 99.999% glitch free. The first time I started a brand new game and arrived in Altago city I had one inexplicable soft-lock while menuing in the item shop where the music kept playing but the game wouldn't respond to any keyboard, mouse or controller input and I lost a whopping 5 minutes from having to re-watch the intro. It never happened again and could easily have been my specific setup deciding to have a brain fart.

Closing thought: If you look at the Ys timeline and put Indiana Jones style travel paths of where Adol has gone on the known Ys world map the sequence of games 4-5-6-7, or Celceta > Xandria > Canaan > Altago, it doesn't actually make a ton of sense. I know 8 comes after 4 but it's self contained on Seiren between Celceta and Kefin so doesn't really change this fact. Xandria and Altago are both on the north end of the "Afroca" with Xandria to the eastern side. Canaan is way far out on the west end of the known ocean. So in order to get from Xandria to Canaan Adol would've had to cross to the north of Altago. Problem is the Altago-Romn war was still in full swing and it's known that Romn had a full naval blockade out in force so there's no way that a journey from Xandria to Canaan makes much sense. I'm sure I'm overthinking it but I couldn't help but notice when I was looking for a world map showing where all these places are in relation to each other.

See you all next time in Ys XI: Monstrum Nox!

author: {'steamid': '76561198158125034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1602218256}
review:
Ys SEVEN, or Ys 7 for the sake of keeping my tradition of numbering the titles of this franchise, is a game that cheated me.

[h1]The Tutorial[/h1]
I am extending the definition of tutorial, but basically I refer to the whole initial segment of the game, you see, for this game's events to happen, Adol has to receive a power-up, yet the reason for you to receive the blessing that forces the plot into motion is...[spoiler]because main character gotta main character[/spoiler], this starts what feels like filler, you go around obtaining power-ups because you are the chosen one, and you are the chosen one because you got the first power-up, see the problem here?, just give me the actual plot of the game early on instead of waiting until I finish this trash of a segment, for example[spoiler]having the king die after you visit the first statue and then playing it the way the original one did by making you a fugitive, then just allow me to push the 1st and 2nd dungeon of each area as one huge dungeon, where the ending of the first dungeon acts as a "Mid Boss" that still gives you the power-up and proves you are worthy of taking on the second dungeon right away.[/spoiler]
It is really this one grave flaw that allowed me to focus so hard on my nitpicks since the plot was so stupid, thus continuing to worsen my experience in an infinite cycle.

[h1]The Nitpicks[/h1]
Long story short, there are three of them for me, in order of how much they annoy me.
[list]
    [*]The Graphics: This can go either of two ways, either "downgrade" this game to look more like Oath of Felghana, or upgrade it to look like the latest games, but these FUCKING UGLY psp models gotta go, and before you even begin, I love PSP games, God Eater Burst is one of my all time favorites be there or in the Steam Remaster, but this game, these graphics, it is so stupid looking that during most story related events I would look at the beautifully drawn artwork as hard as possible to pretend the story was being shown through it and not with these garbage models, just look at Dogi, he looks like a fucking idiot.
    [*]The Rolling: My hand hurts after 19 hours of mashing the "move x10 times faster at no cost" button, give me a stamina bar or nerf it.
    [*]The Battle Voice Acting: HYA! HYA! HYA! HYA! HYA! HYA! HYA! HYA!
[/list]
[h1]The Redemption[/h1]
Against all odds the game redeems most major problems after the tutorial ends and Adol shows up shirtless for a while (what an interesting coincidence), the plot becomes simple yet as effective as an arrow piercing my brain, the bosses become epic and the stakes are properly raised through and through until the game eventually manages to deliver an amazing ending that would've been enough to win me over by itself.
It is almost as if the first draft of the game made it's way into the finished product as what I call "The Tutorial" and then the actual adventure begins, I am given reasons to care, reasons to feel involved, reasons to WANT to travel around amazing new and interesting dungeons and beat ancient beings making me feel like the badass Adol the Red that I deserved to feel since the beginning.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
If you are new to the Ys series do not start with this one, as you may have guessed it is kind of a mixed bag early on and in my case literally had to power through it by will power alone, basing myself only in the trust that the franchise built with me through previous entries... you may have to do the same, just remember that it will be worth it once you rush the bad stuff.

By the way, I had so much to say about this game that steam had me remove half my review to be able to submit it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199052871358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1601800607}
review:
After finishing YsVIII a few years a go I was interested in diving into the world of YS once again and so while onsale I picked up Ys Seven, and I am very glad I did.

This game is a tonne of fun and is straight up addictive action rpg bliss. The combat is fast, frantic and satisfying. I highly reccommend playing this game with a controller. The music is also wonderful delivering a nice rocking soundtrack as you plow through enemies and visit locals.

However this game isn't perfect. The gameplay loop does get very repetitive, it's just a lot of running around killing stuff until you hit the next story event and head to the next dungeon. There are some quests here and there but it's typical JRPG fetch nonsense. Also the while the story is nice and does a servicable job of keeping you engaged, it's nothing new or anything to right home about. It's a standard JRPG tale.

What keeps the game from being boring is just the fact that the gameplay is just so satisfying in my opinion. The combat is so good that you just want to kill everything in sight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173665898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1601664460}
review:
삐르고 역동적인 액션 RPG.
유저 한글화가 되어있어서 인터넷 검색하시면 한글 패치는 다운 받을 수 있습니다.

일반 공격, 회피, 4개의 스킬, 1개의 필살기, 순간적인 방어.
위의 조작들과 적들의 패턴을 파악해 적절히 치고 빠지는 식의 전투를 하게 되는데, 이 전투 느낌이 상당히 역동적이고 경쾌합니다. 거기다 타격감까지 훌륭. 덕분에 30시간 가까이 플레이한 마지막까지도 지루하지가 않았습니다.
참격, 타격, 사격의 3가지 공격 속성이 있고 적마다 약점이 다 달라서 반강제적으로 여러 케릭터들을 이용하여 전투하게 되는데, 이러한 점 역시 좋았네요.

이 게임 이후에 만들어진 '이스: 셀세타의 수해'를 먼저 플레이 했었는데, 그 쪽이 더 세련되었지만 전반적인 전투 시스템은 여기서 이미 완성이 된 것 같네요.

스토리는 이스 시리즈 치고는 꽤나 공들인 느낌이 듭니다.
BGM은 제가 보통 크게 신경 안 쓰고 플레이 하는 편인데, 이 게임은 정말 좋았구요.

여러가지로 장점이 많은 게임입니다.

추천하네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008904705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1601529536}
review:
I just finished this game. I'll be short.

The gameplay is super fun. Hack and slashy with a bit more thought and skill needed than you would think. 

The story is decent. Typical JRPG story. The characters are all fun.

What I personally like about the game is that it is an action-rpg where gameplay is prioritized far over story. You don't have to grind if you're really good. You can beat the game without taking damage if you're skilled enough or super lucky, and I respect game design like that. 

Just a tip: your weapons give you your skills. I made this mistake. Great game! Took me about 34 hours to beat. Hyped for Ys 9!

author: {'steamid': '76561198399766036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2966, 'last_played': 1600721763}
review:
Ys Seven coraggiosamente abbandona lo stile di gioco della leggendaria trilogia che lo precede (Ys VI - Ark of Napishtim, Ys - Oath in Felghana, Ys Origin) per provare qualcosa di nuovo: il gioco in squadra. Lo stile di combattimento è completamente diverso: scompare il salto (ahimè), ma compare la schivata. C'è anche la parata, ma richiede un tempismo molto preciso (Celceta fortunatamente migliorerà ciò). La storia è una delle migliori nella serie di Ys, le musiche sono meravigliose,  i personaggi e l'ambientazione coinvolgono. Il nuovo stile di gioco richiede del tempo per abituarcisi, ma poi non è male. Il gioco è bellissimo, ma essendo il primo del nuovo stile di gioco, ha qualche difetto:
- i personaggi non son molto ben bilanciati. Alcuni, magari sarò io, proprio mi sembrano difficili da usare (es. Mishera)... altri invece (Aisha o Adol) sono divertentissimi. Dogi poi erano 20 anni che lo volevamo impersonare :)
- ci sono troppe armi e armature. Molte sono completamente inutili... diciamo che si sono fatti prendere un pò troppo la mano. Purtroppo per imparare le special moves, occorre acquisire e utilizzare certe armi, quindi vi ritroverete con l'inventario pieno di armi inutili. Celceta migliorerà ciò: il numero di armi e armature torna ad esser ragionevole e le special moves si imparano senza aver come prerequisito una certa specifica arma.
- alcuni boss di fine livello sono sbilanciati. Mi spiego: la maggior parte sono ben fatti e ben calibrati, ma alcuni sono un incubo senza fine. L'uccello gigante e il boss finale su di tutti. Pur facendo un grinding più che adeguato, tali boss hanno una quantità smisurata di energia (siamo nell'ordine delle decine di migliaia di HP), e i personaggi che si usano (specie Mishera...) vengono falciati con pochi colpi. Ho finito Celceta senza mai usare una sola volta una pozione curativa, ma alcuni boss in Ys Seven necessitano di una complessa strategia nella gestione di mille mila pozioni curative sui personaggi della squadra per riuscire ad aver la meglio. Inoltre, la strategia alla fine è più o meno la stessa: un personaggio (tipo Aisha) fa attaccati caricati da lontano, riempiendo la barra degli SP, quindi un secondo personaggio (es. Adol) attacca coi suoi attacchi speciali più potenti (es. il Pentagramma), e infine, quando il boss è stordito e la barra EX è piena, si prende il terzo personaggio (es. Dogi) e si dà il colpo di grazia con la EX move. Ora, solo il 10% dei boss sono super impegnativi, ma stona perché la maggior parte invece sono calibrati benissimo e le battaglie son molto più divertenti. Il problema tuttavia si accentua sul boss finale, perché dovremo usare a turno TUTTI i personaggi, inclusi quelli che non sappiamo usare granché.
Tecnicamente, l'unico vero difetto sono le texture del terreno, che sono abbastanza in bassa risoluzione. Purtroppo è un gioco nato su PSP... su molte texture del gioco (es. personaggi, mostri, ritratti, boss finali) è stato fatto un ottimo lavoro di upscaling, ma purtroppo non è stato possibile su quelle del terreno perché passandole in più alta risoluzione, si sarebbero notati degli artefatti nel punto in cui si congiungono tra loro. Il che è un po' imbarazzante, perché il gioco prima (Ys Origin) ha delle texture molto più dettagliate.

Ys Seven merita, è molto divertente e coinvolgente. Rispetto a quelli della trilogia precedente è molto, molto più lungo (circa 50 ore per finirlo, contro le 15-20 di un run dei precedenti), e mi sento di dire che hanno fatto bene a cercare di innovare la formula. Ha qualche difetto di gioventù, figlia del nuovo approccio, ma tali difetti saranno in parte mitigati nel successivo Celceta (anche se la storia di Ys Seven è nettamente superiore, e Adol è per qualche motivo qui molto più divertente da usare).

review:
Que dire de ce jeu, il a été extrêmement dur à commencé, et une fois commencé il a était terminer d'une traite...

L'histoire est looooongue a se mettre en place, très longue... et par ceci j'entend va rencontrer tes partenaire au quatre coin du pays pendant 5h.. et d'un coup bam ! Le scénario est la et ont accroche !

En revanche dur de se faire à celui tout en ayant joué a celceta, origin, YS8.. 
Une certaine lourdeur est présente dans tout ce que l'on fait, et je parlerais même pas de l'optimisation qui est au fraises..

Pour résumer, si vous aimez les YS, foncez..
Si vous voulez commencer par celui la.. STOP !!! Allez faire un des trois cité plus haut, puis revenez vers celui ci une fois que la franchise sera bien imprégné dans votre peau..


PS : Falcom, toujours présent pour les musique, je vous ai trouvé un peu moins au rendez vous dans cet opus..

author: {'steamid': '76561198815124614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1594099257}
review:
イースシリーズは前作のオリジンまでシステム的に色々と試行錯誤が続いていましたが、今作で後の礎となるシステムが完成しました。6→フェルガナ→オリジンとRPGからアクションゲームへシフトして行きましたがその一つの到達点です。

・グラフィック
元がPSPなので流石にちょっと荒いです。PS2くらいのイメージです。

・戦闘
スキル、エキストラ技、3人PT、斬射打の属性など後のシリーズ基礎となるシステムです。グラフィックはあれですが、アクションゲームとしては十分楽しめます。ボス戦も適度な歯応えがあり良い感じです。操作キャラが一気に増えましたが、どのキャラも特色がありしっかり使えるようにできています。この調整は見事としか言えません。

・シナリオ
展開は王道ですが、ボス戦のアクションと合わさり没入感あります。次作のセルセタよりキャラの掘り下げもしっかりしています。

かつてイースシリーズを遊んだ人も、最近のシリーズを遊んだ人も、初めての人も、イースの一つの原点としてお勧めの作品です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198122808290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1596104592}
review:
the good:
 - The gameplay is simple and easy to understand. Even with the new skill system doesn't make the whole game look complicated. I don't hate Tales series, but there is no "use this skill to interrupt other type of skill, or perform some complex method to perform an 'Ultimate Attack' kind of thing, or vice versa." Also the combat is smooth and the boss does not require huge amount of trial and error, so if you understand the pattern of the boss, you can defeat them in the first try.
 - The story isn't that too complicated, and the characters are just typical as you expect if you watch a lot of anime, but these two aspect doesn't make the overall plot bad. Although Altago looks way more depressing than Romun imo.
 - Soundtracks is a good as ever.
 - Sieg (Geis spell backward) is playable, and Scias boss fight is amazing.
 - The description is true about the total playtime (20 hours). Reason my total playtime is 30 hours is because I was switching discord sharing this game :v
 - The grind in this game is just to help weaker characters to catch up with your mains, so the grind is low, but ...

The bad:
 - Character skills are locked behind weapons (except the one Adol and his Co. start with) unless they reach lv1. Resulting a bit of grinding, but this is not the case.
 - Backtracking in halfway of the game. Are you kidding me?
 - The boss in this game has a habit of "if you get hit just once, they will combo you to death." 2 of them are straight up BS. [spoiler]The bird-looking monster who will guarantee petrify you if he roars, and the first form of final boss where he can spam 4~5 attacks at once leaving you no room to avoid.[/spoiler]
 - You need to grind for the endgame gear (the 50-soul-stones-required ones are optional) for ALL the characters to win the final boss at ease. Otherwise, enjoy getting one-shotted.
 - This is pure optional, but there is no indication to find the side quest, so unless you're too lazy to talk to every single NPCs or look up walkthrough, good luck completing all the side quests.
 - Can Flash Guard get any more broken? o.O
 - Number of girls falling in love with Adol: 0

Do I recommend it? yes, you can't go wrong with Ys series. This is a series that keep things simple yet never fail to screw thing up. My suggestion is that you have to play the game at your own style (challenging, just for storyline, etc) since the series is pretty much jack of all trades, master of none. And this game is old now, so it's still worth $25. I don't know how to wrap thing up, so ...

[spoiler]Mishera best girl, fite me![/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198077655402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2326, 'last_played': 1595810399}
review:
Antes de qualquer coisa, não se engane com a aparência do jogo, não desanime com a aparente baixa qualidade gráfica: o jogo não é feio de forma alguma!

O Port do PSP para PC foi muito bem realizado, melhorando a qualidade gráfica do jogo consideravelmente – claro, sendo guardadas as devidas proporções; de modo que o resultado final foi um jogo com uma boa variação de resoluções; com cores vivas, e, desta forma, bastante colorido. Por sinal, as fotos e trailers promocionais não fazem jus ao resultado final; “in game” você percebe o quanto o jogo realmente ficou bonito comparado a sua antiga versão para PSP.

Isto posto, vamos ao jogo em si: Ys Seven se passa cronologicamente entre “Ys 6: Ark of Napishtim” e “Ys 9: Monstrum Nox”; contando, deste modo, com as aventuras de Adol no país de Altago após o cessa fogo com o Império de Romun. O jogo utiliza o mesmo estilo de gameplay utilizado em “Ys8”, “Ys: Memories of Celceta”, e “Ys9”; sendo justamente em Ys 7 que pela primeira vez esse gameplay é introduzido; logo, diante disso, o gameplay é um pouco inferior aos seus sucessores, porem de forma alguma é ruim – pelo contrario, o jogo é DIVERTIDISSIMO. Por sua vez, a trilha sonora, outro ponto forte da franquia, continua excelente.

Apesar da idade e das limitações da plataforma a qual o jogo foi lançado originalmente, dá para afirmar que Ys Seven envelheceu bem. A historia é boa o suficiente para prender a atenção do jogador, e fazer ele se importar com as implicações dos eventos e seu impacto nos personagens; o gameplay, como já disse antes, é divertidíssimo; a trilha sonora se mantém no excelente nível da franquia; e os gráficos se mostram inesperadamente bonitos. Ou seja, um jogo que definitivamente que vale a pena ser jogado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047090591', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4133, 'last_played': 1597562634}
review:
I didn't know what I was going to think of the graduation of Ys from 2.5D sprites to 3D polygons, or that this would be a party based system rather than a lone adventurer. 

Surprisingly, I actually enjoyed it quite a bit. The gameplay is pretty much the same, as you'll likely be playing with Adol most of the time, but the ability to use a long-ranged character from time to time (especially in boss fights) adds just a tad bit of strategy to the game. While I personally prefer the slashing playstyle I've become accustomed as I've played prior Ys games, it's nice that there are other fighting styles out there to appease any soul, be it archery, pugilism, or even a bloody swallow AKA Serge from Chrono Cross.

The characters are stereotypes with a bit of development, and the story provides enough motivation to keep massacring monsters for their delicious synthesis materials over and over. Surprising character development from one particular smirking individual. This is a Falcom game, so the dialogue of NPCs will change after every major (and sometimes even minor) events, if people like to immerse themselves in the world building of the game.

Anyways, if you're in for a fun romp with a great OST, charming characters, and a fun combat loop, I can see most people playing this on Normal to have a 20ish hour adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025149414', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2799, 'last_played': 1594095010}
review:
Excellent game! 

The battle system switches from a solo character to a party of characters in this installment of the Ys franchise. Adol Christin, our returning main character, is the mainstay of a party of three which includes his good old pal Dogi, a returning side character Geis and several other story centric cast members. To round out the system are the introduction of weapon types and enemy weaknesses. Enemies can now receive slash, blunt or piercing damage from our heroes with Adol capable of dealing all three types by equipping various weapons. Additional features include the ability to use weapon skills and to perform super moves. Weapon skills require varying amounts of SP meter usage while super moves require full ES meter usage.

The story picks up when Adol and Dogi set foot in the land of Altago which is fresh out of a war with the Romn empire. Foreigners are heavily scrutinized but Adol and Dogi soon gain an audience with the King thanks to the King's association with the renowned boat captain Ladoc. The two are soon asked to investigate the strange going-ons currently happening in the land and to report back their findings. What ensues is an adventure that sees our heroes exploring several villages to commune with the spirits of the Dragons of the land in order to gain their powers in a bid to quell the disorder currently plaguing the kingdom. 

The story is entertaining and keeps the player engaged throughout. Pacing is good and nothing ever feels dragged out. Dungeons progressively get longer and more complicated with the last two housing some nice puzzles and well hidden items/areas. 

Veterans to the Ys series can start out on hard difficulty while newcomers are recommended to start on normal difficulty. If boss fights are kicking your butt then you're probably underleveled which the Ys series is notorious about. 

Something not explained anywhere in the in-game manual is the presence of a parry mechanic. Parries enable you to 1) block all incoming damage while 2) also filling the SP and ES meters and 3) if you attack just after a parry you will do critical damage. Parries must be performed just before an attack would land. Miss the timing and you will receive critical damage instead. I highly recommend changing the in-game controls so that parries are performed with a single button instead of two as normally, you're required to hold one button first and then tap the other to perform the parry.

Learning how to parry can greatly reduce the difficulty of some fights as otherwise you're only defensive recourse is to dodge out of the way. This is fine for most of the fights but some of the later ones may become bullet hells.

The lack of in-game information on parries is the only thing I can knock this game for as everything else was great and made for a fun ride while it lasted. Also, I haven't looked this up yet but given that you're trying to gain the power of the dragons of Altago, Adol and his party are referred to as Dragon Warriors on a Dragon Quest! I'm guessing this was done in homage to the Dragonquest series as it's hard not to miss the references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077589322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1637726634}
review:
Ok, if we had a "Maybe" on the reccomendation button I would press that. Lemme elaborate.

Storywise, this game is good. Musicwise this game is awesome. However this is a PSP game, and PSP games are very weird when you emulate then. Lemme give you an example: You play YS Oath in Felghana, do you feel the game needs better graphics? That kind of setup is good, ageless either, it doesn't need a remake because it's already a remake but this one aged poorly.

But yeah if this was just an emulation I would be less salty, but there are other ports of this game on China that did a better job fixing and giving better textures to the game. YES, there are mods to fix it, but so far I never was able to make the boats in Altago to look good.

Now, about the game in itself: I dunno why XSEED loves this but the configurations are outside and inside the game, however it's kinda hard to configure the joystick, I was able to do so by closing my eyes and remembering where all the buttons were in the PSP version, but lemme tell you: They are not the same here, it's confusing. That's an issue I have with the Memories too.

SO, if you open a game's forum four years after a game release and there's still people asking how they setup the controls because they aren't figuring out, something is wrong with the port.

Everything that's good on this game is either on Falcom itself (since this game is a must on PSP) or on players who are also fans are figured out how to make better textures for the game. And sadly, that's a common thing with XSEED ports.

So yeah, buy the game if you really want to know more about it, it's a good game, if you can setup it correctly and if the lack of polish on the textures won't mess with your head, you'll have a blast on this game. Now, if you want an easy setup with the best iteration of this game so far, I would say that the Chinese are way better equipped than us.


Besides, at this point now, buying a game from XSEED really is showing support to the series? NISA have all the rights currently to work with Falcom games, they are even bringing the Crossbell series finally to us (A think XSEED just decided to skip), so buy it if you're a fan, the excuse of supporting the series to be released here can only be thrown now with games that are over Nisa's hands now anyway. 


Again: Good game, horrible port (almost as bad as Memories of Celceta).

review:
PSPを持っていないので手を出す機会がなかったSEVENをようやくプレイできた。PC版を出してくれたことに感謝感謝。ゲーム音痴の自分でもNormal30時間でなんとかクリア。PCゲームと考えるとデザイン・画質等々古臭いがPSP版が元になっているらしいので仕方なし。戦闘は、正直敵の属性に合わせてメンバーを交代するのが面倒だった。。アクションが攻撃と回避しかないのも面白みに欠けた。回避ボタン連打しないと移動がとろいのはもう少しなんとかして欲しかったな。YSの音楽は好きなんだけど、、今回は耳に残るものは少なかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994891465', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2391, 'last_played': 1592608697}
review:
I remember playing this on PSP a while back, and was excited that it was being ported to PC, allowing me to play with a proper controller... but also cleaner visuals, and 60fps support.

This is possibly one of the best Ys games currently available. It's the furthest chronologically (Ys 8 actually takes place after 4... don't ask), and while it doesn't quite have some of the newer aspects that Celceta and 8 have, it makes up for this with a bunch of features that add a substantial depth to it.

It's also one of the longer entries in the series, and the more expansive one that has the largest cast of characters (title isn't just the entry, it's how many characters are technically playable). It also features a more standard JRPG structure than any previous entry, foregoing the Zelda approach of things with something that's more... "standard". This might seem a bit unconventional, but it works incredibly well in it's favor.

If you've been curious about the Ys series in general, and weren't sure which entry you should dive into... this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039472803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1590730674}
review:
1.그래픽 겁나 구림. 09년도 psp기반 출시라고 해도 너무 구린건 사실임.
2.스토리 좋음. 마지막에는 진짜 뭉클했음. 8하기전에 이 작품했으면 스토리한정 인생작품은 7이 돼었을듯
3.사운드 개좋음. 팔콤이 게임못만드는데 bgm 잘만든다고 음반회사라고 놀림받는데, 진짜 BGM 하나만큼은 끝내줌.  메인화면 브금은 진짜 게임 끝나고 들으면 잊을수가 없다.
5. 전투템포는 경쾌함. 회피는 아무때나 가능한대신 어드벤티지가 없고, 가드는 필살기 게이지를 채워주는 어드벤티지가 있지만 대신 타이밍을 맞춰야하고 실패하면 크리티컬로 맞는다는 리스크가 있음. 어찌됐든 이 겜 쉽게 깨려면 가드는 마스터해야함.
6. 보스패턴은 전투시스템에 최적화된 보스패턴이라고 생각함.  직관적이기에 몸으로 반응해야하는 패턴들임.  스릴있게 즐길 수 있었음
7. 총평:난 그래픽이 내 눈을 테러하는 수준이여도 내가 재밌기만 하면 상관없다 OR 팔콤 특히 이스8 개쩔게 플레이했다 한다면 진짜 앵간하면 플레이하는걸 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367785833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1585315087}
review:
シリーズのファンです。発売直後にPSPでプレイしたのですが、再プレイしたくなり購入しました。
英語音声は違和感ありますが、まあ許容範囲です。残念ですけどね。（しかし今思うとボイスオプションの「アドルのみOFF」ってすごいな）

アクションが下手なのでノーマルでやったのですが、こんなに強かったっけ！？　と思うほどボスが強いです。でも死にゲーというほどではないのが絶妙。ゴリ押しできそうでできないので、その分パターンを覚えて勝てた時の喜びがすごいです。
また、ストーリーもすごく良い。内容をまったく覚えてませんでしたが、最後はもう…泣けました。
そして何より音楽ですね。素晴らしいなと思います。サントラを聴きまくっていた当時を思い出しました。
グラフィックについてはまあ仕方がないか～と思いますが、グラ重視の人は厳しいと思います。PS1くらいの感じですし。
というわけで、ARPGが好きで、グラフィックはあんまり気にしない人には、とってもおすすめできます。

余談ですが、昔PCで6をプレイした時、「もっとストーリーが長ければ…町もいくつかあればどんなにいいか…」と思っていたので、最近はささやかな夢が叶ったな～という感覚です。

review:
그래픽이 아쉽지 않다면 거짓말이지만,
그래도 충분히 잘 만든 게임입니다.

팔콤의 사운드야 워낙 유명하고,
이스 특유의 빠른 전투 템포, 스토리 진행이 게임에 몰입할 수 있게 도와줍니다.

다만 부분부분 소재나 돈 때문에 조금씩 노가다를 강요하는 부분은 아쉽네요.

그래픽에 크게 신경쓰지 않는 분들이라면 꼭 한번쯤 즐겨보시는 것도 좋을 것 같습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000807456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1851, 'last_played': 1590062487}
review:
I really enjoyed this entry into the Ys series, however man was I not prepared for the final boss. At first, I was making sure to constantly farm and grind a little on monsters for parts to make money and create equipment for everyone, but as the party grew in size, and the end of the game nearing, I got a little lazy and only focused on the three members I used the most.

Boy was that a mistake, the final boss actually consists of multiple battles featuring different party members, so I was left with an unbeatable boss due to having them under-levelled and under-powered with their current equipment.

But overall, I loved the game and the story, and it was a fun ride while it lasted. I'm not a big fan of the 3D graphics when compared to the previous games, but I do understand that this game was originally on the PSP, and the newer 3D games look a lot better. Looking forward to playing Memories of Celceta next!

review:
Oyun 'Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim'den' 6 ay sonrasında geçmektedir. Adol ve Dogi daha fazla macera aramak için yola çıkarlar ve Altago City denen liman kentine varırlar. Oradaki askeri birliklerden biriyle bir nedenden dolayı tartışan ikilimiz kendilerini hapishanede bulurlar. Yayılmış olan ünleri kralın kulağına kadar gider. Ve kral ülkede gerçekleşen yerli yersiz depremlerin kaynağının araştırılması için bizim 2 maceracımızı bu göreve yollar.

-Diğer yorumlar çok güzel anlattığı için en kısa ve basit şekilde yazacağım.

Ys Seven seri içinde görüp görebileceğiniz en kötü grafiklere sahip oyun. Port olan diğer oyun Ys: Memories of Celceta'nın yanından geçemez. 

Bunun dışında oyun herşeyiyle diğer port oyun Ys: Memories of Celceta'nın kopyası. Ana görev ve yan görevler, skill, yetenek ve oynanışlar, grafikler (bu oyun daha kötü)...

İtemlerde Celceta'dan farklı; burada itemleri craftlayabiliyoruz. Celceta da ise satın aldıgımız itemlere + basabiliyorduk..

Oynanış süresi olarak normalde 18-22 saat arası sürüyor.. Bundan önceki oyunları alıp oynadıysanız bu oyunu alıp oynarsınız ve bazı şeylerini görmezden gelebilirsiniz...

Kendime göre puan tablom ise;

50 < Oynanmaya değmez
51 - 59 = Çok Kötü
60 - 69 = Kötü
70 - 79 = İdare Eder
80 - 89 = İyi
90 - 95 = Çok iyi
96 - 99 = Mükemmel
100 = Yok öyle bir oyun.

PUAN = 85

author: {'steamid': '76561199051198688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2803, 'last_played': 1604732341}
review:
PCではやっていましたが、SteamでのYsシリーズ＆Ys SEVENプレイいずれも初です。
Easyモードで45時間ほどかけてGW中にクリアしました。音声は英語ですが、掛け声位なので私個人としては特に気にせず。
テキストは全て日本語対応しています。途中で落ちるなどのトラブルもありません。

最初のコントローラの設定で自分が使いやすいものにするのに手間取りましたが、ゲーム内の操作性はストレスなく。
ストーリーは王道ですが、もう少し小粒の冒険かと思っていたのでいい意味で予想を裏切られました。最後は泣きました。
最もよかったことは、昨今の自粛の時期の最中に家にいながら旅をしている気分になれたことだったと思います。
但し、VIを未プレイの方は、登場人物程度でよいので把握しておくとSEVENがより楽しめるかと。
音楽も大変素晴らしく、何度も聞きなおしています。

余りアクションが得意とは言えないのですが、弱点や攻略のくせを理解して戦えばアイテムなどは使うにせよ、
ほぼ一発でクリアできていたので自分にとってはちょうどよい手ごたえのある難易度だと思いました。
（現在セルセタをやっていますが、こちらのEasyはSEVENよりごり押しできてしまう感を感じます）

author: {'steamid': '76561198843844121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2395, 'last_played': 1600555793}
review:
PSP版のプレイ経験あり。
PS4の８、セルセタ、９が面白かったため久しぶりにプレイしたくなり購入しました。

PSPからの追加要素は特にないようですが、画質をあげればセルセタと同じ程度の見た目にはなります。
Mac mini 2012 の内蔵グラフィック、 BootCamp Windows 10環境で快適に動作しました。

３人のメンバーを選んでプレイするのは７が最初です。
７以外はアドルをメンバーから外すことができますが、７ではアドルを外すことができません。
またスキルも新しい武器を入手することで習得するといった違いがあります。７で煩雑だった部分が以降は簡略化されて遊びやすくなっている感じですね。

難易度は７が一番高いです。７以外はNORMAL難易度なら初見でも回復薬なしでたいていクリアできますが、７は回復薬を使いまくって何とかクリアというボスもチラホラ。特にラスボスは全然倒せなくてレベル上げをしました。
ただアクションとしてみると７が一番面白いです。ゴリ押しが効かず、しっかりと弱点を見極めて戦う必要があるので。

ストーリーは良くも悪くもイース。滅びの風だったりラクリモサだったり大変な世界ですね。

何とか日本語音声は対応してほしいですね。自分としてはドギは耐えられたが、アイシャのパリピっぽい感じがどうしても耐えられなくて音声オフにしました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 2600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2600, 'last_played': 1587515865}
review:
Hello friends,

Today i will be reviewing Ys 7. I have been playing the Ys games in numerical order, not in canonical order, and being the 7th in the series, this is the latest review for the series that i am doing. Ys 7 uses a newer game engine then it's previous game, Ys 6. This game is alot like Ys 4: Memories of Celceta. Ys 7 features party control, synthesis, and many improvements compared to Ys 6. This is the first game that features DOGI as a playable character in the party. As expected, all his moves are based on punching. There are also new and old friends joining ADOL back in this game. The boss fights are a bit more involved in this game, having you making boss's get a opening or finding their weakness and exploiting it with a specific party member.

Here is my Pro/Con list:

PROS:

- A return of the same game engine used in Ys IV: memories of celceta.
- Dogi and other party members can be played, alongside ADOL of course. You can even control them on the maps, but some npc's will act like there still talking to Adol.
- Synthesis for weapons, armors, and items is back in this game.
- A huge map to explore and different places.
- Nice music for area's.

CONS:

- It will take awhile to farm for certain weapons and armors. This can slowdown your game with grinding, espeically on the harder settings.
- Compared to Ys 4: memories of celceta, this game feels more watered down version of it..like the settings were more basic in this version.

If your a Ys series fan, i recommend it for series fans. If not, consider whether you want to get a watered down version of Ys 4: Memories of Celceta. If not a fan of the series, you might want to get it on sale.

NOTE: Memories of Celceta came out much later than after 7.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110717365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3057, 'last_played': 1587638698}
review:
Avec ce YS seven YS prend un nouveau cap et établira les bases de l'excellent YS VIII !

Pour une fois Adol n'échoue pas sur une plage il arrive à bon escale en bateau et ... B.OR.DEL c'est quoi ce polygone rouge !!!

Attendez, c'est.. c'est... ADOL !!??

Et oui YS seven a aussi pris un tournant graphique pour passer à du full 3d et... qu'est ce que c'est moche !
Oath, Ark font office d'oeuvre d'art à coté...

Bon ok j'exagère un peu mais quand tu vas sur la terrasse au dessus du port on y voit une grande statue et à ses pieds deux bateaux, c'est beau bateaux ultra pixelisé, on croirait que le mec à fait un lancé de pixel pour les faire XD

Bon au bout d'un moment on s'y fait et ... HO B.OR.DEL!! Il c'est passé quoi avec Dogi ??
Je crois que Dogi a fait une escale aux states !! Il est ultra cubique, quand il court on dirait un gros pateau et son visage est carré mais carré !! Horrible, cela ne correspond pas du tout aux artwork de Dogi des autres opus...

Sur tous les personnage d'ailleurs, c'est lui le plus moche même quand il est en artwork dans le jeu...

Passé cette atrocité, on retrouve un bon jeu rythmé que ce soit par la musique que par les combats.
On retrouve pour la premiere fois la possibilité de jouer trois personnage.

Par contre mauvais point, les personnages vont et viennent dans le groupe, du coup difficile de focus sur un pour le pexer...

Les personnages ont une catégorie d'attaque physique, percant ou contondant.
Les monstres pour la plupart craignent une catégorie et on va alors switché d'un perso à un autre pour les attaquer.

On a l'arrivé de skill 13 par personnage, alors attention les skills doivent s'apprendre par le biais de l'arme qu'on acquiert, en effet quand on obtient une arme elle a un skill qui faut monter au niveau 1 pour l'apprendre.
Ce système moisi (oui disons le) risque de vous faire passer à coté de certains skill, il est donc conseillé de ne pas vendre les armes pour éviter ce genre d'incident.

Les skills c'est sympa quand on les utilise, cependant elles consomment des SP qui est une barre de mana partagée par les 3 persos. Elles se remplissent quand on fait une attaque chargé ou en tapant les mobs.
On a là aussi un probleme, les skills sont énergivore si bien qu'on va surtout taper normalement plutot que jongler avec les différents skills (du moins sur le 3/4 du jeu) et les skills à gros coup seront donc que très peu joué.

Mais ne vous méprenez pas, car ce jeu reste excellent, on prend plaisir à rouler sur les mobs, la difficulté nigthmare est très bien dosée, on ne va pas passer 3h sur un boss mais on ne le fera pas non plus fleur au fusil. On a quand même droit à quelques boss bien chiants comme l'araignée (le pire pour moi) où le loup dans le colysée (enfin jusqu'à qu'on comprenne comment le gérer ^^) et Moon dragon (là c'est ma faute j'ai trop ignoré Le SKILL d'un des persos qui change tout ^^).

D'ailleurs un des persos se démarque un peu trop des autres, ce qui va nous pousser à le jouer plus que les autres.

L'histoire bien que classique avec leur donjon du feu, de l'eau, de l'air, de la terre, du coeur (ha non ca c'est dans cap'taine planete !) est prenante on a le droit à de beaux rebondissements est une fin très réussi (préparez vos mouchoirs !)

Les personnages qui accompagnent Adol sont très réussis comme toujours dans les YS.

YS Seven est donc un renouveau réussi de la série de YS 
Il a certes quelques imperfections (gommé dans le VIII) mais ils sont balayés par les autres éléments du jeu.

YS Seven est excellent !! 



***** Petit Spoil en rapport avec le VIII *****

Par contre en finissant le jeu, j'ai été décu de voir les similitude scénaritique avec le VIII (la révélation du vent de la destruction ainsi que le combat vs boss final qui suit de beaucoup le même style)

author: {'steamid': '76561198858190851', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1585708935}
review:
[h1]An amazing adventure that defined modern Ys[/h1]

Ys Seven is certainly different from the older games that had isometric 2D graphics. It keeps the same fast paced action that the series is known for and adds a lot of new skill sets, better enemy variety, a much longer story that took about 24 hours to beat and the ability to change the characters at any time.
Being able to change the characters and having them together with Adol makes the game a lot more fun because of their interactions and development into the story. Each of the characters have their own set of skills and an attack type (slash, strike, pierce) that are important to explore each enemy's weakness.
The story is interesting with some drama, plot twist points and an emotional ending; a big upgrade over the previous games in my opinion.
Soundtrack is amazing as always, it's impossible to go wrong when it's about Ys Music.

One thing to consider though is that this game is originally a PSP game, so it was limited by the console's hardware capabilities. It is certain that even though it's a full 3D Ys game, it's a graphical downgrade compared to the previous isometric 2D titles. Some of the character models look really weird and the textures are very low resolution.
I also had random frame rate issues, specially when entering rooms in the city. This affected the gameplay a little bit since the game slows down when frame rate drops, but nothing really game breaking.

Overall it's a good Ys adventure: it has a much better story compared to previous titles and adds the ability to play with more characters making gameplay a lot more dynamic, but it was limited by the hardware it was originally developed for downgrading in graphics and style. Not my favorite Ys game, but I had a lot of fun with it and I liked the story.
The game is well designed and has everything a good game needs to have: good controls, good story, good music. The limitations are basically just in it's graphics due to the PSP hardware but I know it gets a lot better in the next game, Ys Memories of Celceta.

This longer story format, full 3D graphics and multiple playable characters defined what modern Ys is. Ys Celceta and Ys VIII follow what has been set here in Ys Seven. It is a departure from 2D graphics and solo Adol.

review: Gra jest cudowna - zresztą jak każda z serii. Wracają ukochane postacie (można kierować Dogim), historia znów wciąga a system walki jest miodny. Jedynym minusem jest tutorial. Słowo daje miałam ochotę rzucać klawiaturą. W innych częściach Ys podstawy wyjaśniano ciekawie - nawet stary wyjadacz się nie nudził mimo, że wiedział co i jak. A tu? Nudy to za mało powiedziane. Strasznie mi przypomina to trening z Raymana 3 i sławny tekst "klawisz ataku służy do ataku!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198330355236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1696, 'last_played': 1661840131}
review:
在等9代中文前花了好长时间打完了7代，不得不说，伊苏这系列不仅没烂作，而且神作真的太多了（目前除了5和9没玩过，树海4不是特别好外，其他全部都不错，9代个人感觉估计也很不错）
所以先下结论：[h1]别犹豫，买，只要你是法老控。不是的话可以考虑打折入手，毕竟十年前的游戏了[/h1] 
steam版就是把贴图，抗锯齿稍微优化了点，然后手柄操作更加顺滑。但不知道为什么，有的场景特效多起来游戏速度就自动变慢，不知道是不是我一个人遇到这问题。
不过再怎么优化，这代画质真的不行
（毕竟7代投的资金不少用在双星2了，然后双星2暴死，法老控放弃pc端，为了照顾psp的性能画质只能这样，悲）（玩过双星2的应该都能明显感觉出来这画质真的差太多了）
不过法老控的画质我们都懂，但这代剧情是伊苏轨迹化的第一步，比之前的伊苏多了不少文戏，人物刻画和剧情发展都比之前的伊苏好很多，个人感觉仅次于伊苏8
（7代和8代都玩过的我甚至感觉8代剧情和7代有不少异曲同工之处，但8代文笔明显下的更多，剧情也更出色，比如两代女主的刻画就差了不少，[spoiler] 虽然八代对达娜的刻画的确过多了[/spoiler] ）
战斗系统这代也是大转变（这系统一延续就是延续了4代，估计9代之后会换新）
技能的加入的确让战斗更加爽快了！但是要注意的是技能是通过使用新武器获得的，所以除非你的技能在换武器前练到了一级以上，否则你换了武器技能就会失效，这算是7代比较坑的地方（树海之后就没这个设定了）
给几条提醒：
这作难度较大，回复道具全都有限制，而且还是个位数，树海和8代入坑的可能会不适应
最后boss战是全员上场的四连战，而且boss本身也特别难，所以别忘了给所有人都刷下等级！重点培养红发色魔！



（二月初我们9代监狱都市见XD）

author: {'steamid': '76561198070971744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1822, 'last_played': 1544325756}
review:
Most favourite to not so favourite:

Ys: The Oath in Felghana
Ys I
Ys VIII: The Lacrimosa of Dana
Ys Seven *
Ys II
Ys: Memories of Celceta
Ys VI: The Ark of Naphitism
Ys Origin
Ys IX: Monstrum Nox

The first game in the series to introduce the party style combat that is still being used to this day. A great introduction to the format and a cast I ended up enjoying quite a bit. 20+ hours that are a ride from start to finish but also doesn't overstay its welcome.

The combat in this game is very satisfying with boss fights on Nightmare hitting just the right amount of difficulty, albeit the health pools can be a bit too much but with all 3 party members fighting it can go down quickly. The game certainly isn't too good looking though as it is a PSP port with some upscaling. I do hope it gets some sort of updated version to clean it up as it is a wonderful experience in the Ys world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074134910', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1629653631}
review:
Fun, but probably the sloppiest of the Ys games with a party following you around (SEVEN, Celceta, VIII).  The bosses frequently dont telegraph their attacks, so beating them on the highest difficulty requires a bit of die and try again trial and error gameplay.  It's absolutely still satisfying to bring them down, though, and probably worth the frustration.

This game has a lot less atmosphere to it than Celceta and VIII, with Celceta feeling like a true unexplored forest and VIII really getting that colony of castaways feeling.

Worth it on a sale, but I'd check out the other games first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344310117', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1577458853}
review:
[h1]Ys Seven[/h1]
8/10
Playtime: 30Hours (Diff: Hard)

Synopsis:
Adol and Dogi reach the Capital of Altago in an attempt to find more adventure. While exploring the town, they get into trouble trying to save two sisters who were being harassed by the local Dragon Knights, which is the army force of Altago. They are thrown into the cells but thanks to their reputation as adventurers, they get a request from the king to help him investigate some strange earthquakes going on lately, as his men have not been able to find anything. On their way, they find out the Five Dragons are awakening once again to prevent a great catastrophe, lending their power to Adol to help stop it.

Pro:
+The New Team Gameplay
+Flash Guard System
+Dogi and Geiz Playable
+The World Building Story is more rich
+The Plot Twist 
+The Colloseum Scene is EPIC
+Falcom Music Seal of Quality (That OP song still DOPE)

Cons:
-Repetitive Dungeon on second act
-Weak Motive for Antagonist
-Some secondary character need more time to flesh out
-Dragon Boss Fight 

Mixed:
=Weapon Skill based acquisition 
=Flash Guard Timing can be finicky
=RNG Item material

I'm typing this just after finishing the game ... and, what a game!
The gameplay is incredibly addictive, good music, the boss fights where kind of ... easy? not what i expected after playing through the other games to be honest, BUT THE BOSS MUSIC ROCKS!, just google "  Vacant Interference Ys Seven" and that alone will make you but the game.

Definitely my favorite part of this game is the story, i loved every main and secondary character, the development is amazing, and if you spend time talking to every NPC you get to fully invested into the plot, and how every event affects Altago. 

A great experience and i would definitely play it again and recommend it, the ending had me crying like a baby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814427176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9811, 'last_played': 1576124663}
review:
先日、実績コンプ達成しました。
10年前のゲームですが古臭さを感じさせず、楽しんでプレイできました。
イースシリーズ初のパーティバトルを導入し、個性的なキャラがたくさんいます。
インフェルノは歯ごたえ抜群で、ボス戦での戦略性も高いです。
ただ不満があるとすれば、周回要素がない点です。
どれだけキャラを育てても、クリアしたらそれで終わり。
再プレイしようという気がなかなか起きません。
周回があればインフェルノも楽になり、実績コンプしたい人が購入したはずです。
重ね重ねそれが残念です。
今から周回パッチ作ってくれないかなあ．．．

author: {'steamid': '76561198025342840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1633457316}
review:
A fun game with worthy additions to the typical Ys gameplay. Typical to Nihon Falcom games, the story and characters itself are pretty much Anime clichee storm but later on manage to surprise with some neat twists.

What I miss is the ability to jump, a staple of the previous games, as it removes the neat platforming sections and puzzles that I liked in previous games of this series. Nonetheless the dungeon designs are still very well done and engaging. Combine that with a legit well-done soundtrack and you got a worthy entrance to the Ys series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059193133', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1573128234}
review:
Picked this up during the XSeed sale for 14.99 after finishing both Origins and The Oath in Felghana. While drastically different, it was a nice change of pace from that game engine.

The only real complaint I can even think of is that the Companion AI is practically retarded. You could be trying to gather from a resource node and they'll be running into a wall trying to get at an enemy who happens to be on a higher plane off screen from my current location instead of helping me speed up the process. It's a minor gripe for what was otherwise a solid game with an engaging story and likable characters.

If it pops on sale again and you're a fan of Ys or just action RPGs in general, you could do much worse than Ys Seven.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216133847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1573000243}
review:
Ys Seven, being the first game in the series to be both 3D *and* feature a party system systematic to most modern JRPGs, especially the Tales series, definitely had its fair share of problems (of course this is my own thoughts). The party AI is definitely not the best. As you attack, your party members do a one-note attack (literally, they don't combo), and do half or even less damage than what that character would do WITH the normal attack if you were controlling them. They also do not use Skills by themselves, and usually use relatively weak ones when you use a Skill. Another issue I had is the bosses. Damage sponges for most of the game, up until the start of basically the straight shot to the finish. Killing monsters doesn't net you all the loot. Gotta sit there and hack at the corpse a bit. This adds up to a lot of extra time and gets a bit boring. 

Other than this though, the game was nothing short of amazing being Falcom's first 3D Ys. The story was fantastic, had really great writing with a well-set tone at basically the start of the game, and really shows you in detail the kinds of things Adol did and went through while he was in Altago. You even get to see some familiar faces and, as always, there's tons of throwbacks to the previous titles if you look for them or notice them! I am for sure excited to dive into Ys VIII after this. If you're unsure whether you want to try the first 3D Ys game, I can tell you its definitely worth it. Especially at the sale price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992029231', 'num_games_owned': 4127, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 4713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1629258364}
review:
A lovely evolution of the combat systems employed in the Napishtim engine games (VI, The Oath in Felghana, and finally Origins), this is definitely a far more story-driven affair that's more interested in getting into the affairs of the locals than prior games to it, and from the prior games eschews the previously capped-at-60 level system for a game that is on the whole more ambitious and more RPG-like in scope. AI can tend to be a bit derpy, and if you're in a certain proximity to a gathering spot they will frequently give up on battle and go do that instead. On the whole though, your allies are a welcome addition to have on the field and given the strengths/weaknesses and being able to switch on the fly, it's a system I solidly feel positive about. It's also worth noting that the game runs smooth as butter and is generally fairly well-optimized. The combat is as polished as you would expect of an Ys game- if you've played one before, you already know how this works. If you don't, then the combination of skills tied to weapons was introduced in Ys VI but has been massively expanded here. Weapons let you take their skill forever after level 1. Many weapons have skills you'll find in both earlier and later weapons, so as to not outright require you to buy every weapon to get your favorite. On the whole, the story, as per usual with Ys games, definitely has some feels moments to it, and Altago feels like a very fleshed-out place with this game.

Post review note: If you're planning on playing these in chronological order, it goes Origin> Book 1 & 2 (they are technically directly linked)> Memories of Celceta (4 remake)> The Oath in Felghana (3 remake)> 5 (currently unlocalized outside of Japan and not on Steam)> Lacrimosa of Dana (8) > The Ark of Napishtim (6) > Seven > Monstrum Nox (9, also not yet localized and also not on Steam presumably for some time, now confirmed to be canonically last). It's far from an ideal order to follow, but it IS canon, so...

author: {'steamid': '76561198025111684', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2226, 'last_played': 1570391383}
review:
Flawless port of the first in the latest current of "party based" Ys games. Seven boasts a charming (certainly blocky, due to the PSP origin of the title) artstyle, awesome OST (as always) and what I consider to be my favorite gameplay system for the series.

You control a party of three active characters and different characters have different damage attributes (slash, strike and pierce) so you must switch your character depending on the situation, to exploit the vulnerability of the monsters. It's a fast and fun system, with loads of unique skills per character and powerful ultimate Extra Skills to unleash. The system wasn't quite perfect yet, it has a few annoyances, but it's overall great fun.

The story is an improvement over the previous titles (bar Origin) as far as I'm concerned. It's still fairly simple stuff, with some clichés, but the simplicity of the storytelling is a specialty of Falcom: the pacing is great and the story is really engrossing despite being so classic in its approach. The fact that you have party members means that you have side characters that are more fleshed out than in the "solo Adol" Ys games, and therefore more connected to the player. I really enjoyed my staying in the land of Altago and its inhabitants.

Overall, another great Ys game. Must buy if you want a fun, fast and simple action JRPG. Hail Falcom!

author: {'steamid': '76561198324746818', 'num_games_owned': 6580, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 1729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1569378272}
review:
[quote]

[h1]前言[/h1]

《Ys SEVEN》中文译为伊苏Ⅶ，是由开发商Nihon Falcom制作的一款经典动作角色扮演类游戏，是《伊苏》系列的第七部正统续作，于2009年09月17日发行（PSP）。《Ys SEVEN》的剧情故事发生在“翼之民”事件(也就是《伊苏6》的剧情)半年后，披着一头独特的红发的亚特鲁在受到卡玛尔国王的接见后，接受了调查阿鲁达格公国近期异变的任务。毕竟9120年了，玩家都是一群视觉动物，对于09年的游戏画质大部分玩家可能是难以接受的。虽然Steam上的《Ys SEVEN》不支持中文并且没有日语语音，但是早已有民间汉化，并且还有大佬分享了日语语音以及高清材质补丁，如今回眸这部作品，秉着情怀推荐这部作品给大家，游戏定价也不贵，喜欢这类JRPG的玩家可以乘着打折购入一波。[spoiler]汉化补丁地址：s/1Ny4wf6ESSZPYcGbgtC4DPg，密码：rpt6[/spoiler]

[h1]游戏体验[/h1]

[b][u]1️⃣详实的新手教程：[/u][/b]
　　游戏的新手教程是非常详细的，但是游戏的任务指引是本作的瑕疵之一。游戏开始领略完驰骋于大海之上的舒适感之后，来到了阿尔塔戈这片亚特鲁憧憬已久的大地。但是下船之后什么指引都没有，地图上并无任何提示，只能摸索进入各个区域去试探是否有主线剧情触发。给新手玩家一个友情的提示就是，第一章买了话之后需要同水池边买香草的女孩（缇雅）对话才能触发剧情，如果不查看攻略，恐怕新手村都出不去。随着主线的推进，千龙长塞亚斯会是你出道的“新手教官”。从基础的操作、闪避、防御，再到技能、装备的使用都一一用“实操”转述给玩家。本作与[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/587110/Ys_Memories_of_Celceta/]『Ys: Memories of Celceta』[/url]相比并未把Extra技能直接解放出来，而是结合剧情在洞窟中解锁了Extra技能。

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869666216]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869666216[/url]

[b][u]2️⃣形态各异的角色系统：[/u][/b]
　　初始玩家可以使用的角色只有红发男主亚特鲁·克里斯汀和人物建模像多啦A梦里的胖虎多奇，后续跟着主线任务的推进各种各样的角色会逐一解锁，比如艾夏、艾里克等。

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869689734]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869689734[/url]

游戏采用的是类似于无双大蛇一样的三人协同战斗，玩家主要操控一名角色，其余角色由电脑控制，玩家可以在游戏设置电脑的战斗方式，避免角色莽撞行事轻易嗝儿屁。但是在无双大蛇中切换角色变得可有可无，因为玩家只需要游玩自己想玩的角色割草爽就完事儿了，而在本作中切换人物是必不可少的一个操作，在游戏中设定了三种攻击属性，“斩”（克制柔软的敌人）、“打”（克制坚硬的敌人）、“射”（克制灵巧的敌人），每个角色会拥有其中一种攻击属性，攻击属性和怪物自身的抗性存在相生相克的关系，会直接影响角色对怪物造成的伤害数值，如果想打出高伤害，就需要玩家合理的切换角色对怪物造成伤害，这样做的好处除了提升玩家的游戏体验之外，还让玩家感到不在孤独，自己并不是一个人在战斗。如果你是一个独狼玩家（喜欢Solo），那么不好意思这款游戏可能不是很适合你，因为这个游戏没有设置单人战斗的选项🤣。

[b][u]3️⃣熟悉的味道，熟悉的攻击系统：[/u][/b]
　　本作的攻击系统和前几作一样，除了普通攻击以外，你还可以释放蓄力攻击、技能以及终极技。普通攻击和蓄力攻击虽然伤害数值几乎一样，但是获得SP可以说是大相径庭的，蓄力攻击虽然耗时比较长，但是可以获得大量的SP，对于Boss战斗的时候如果站撸打不过，个人建议风筝式打法，用蓄力攻击去攻击Boss，存取足够的SP之后将Boss击晕，然后疯狂释放技能进行输出。释放技能需要消耗SP，如果技能击中敌人，会为终极技充能，当终极技充能完毕之后方可释放，对敌人造成大量伤害。

[b][u]4️⃣食之无味的画面，倍感舒适的配乐：[/u][/b]
　　游戏的画面分为两种，一种是游戏的建模不忍直视，如果不是打上中文补丁看到了人物名字，可能我会一时语噻，说不出这个人物到底是谁，特别是那个长得像胖虎的多奇，emm……；而另一种则是游戏的过场动画以及CG，还是一如既往的精致、细腻。

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869630705]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1869630705[/url]

　　《Ys SEVEN》的主题曲继承了这个系列一向爽朗愉悦的节奏，光听主题曲就让人心潮澎湃，迫不及待想拿起手柄加入冒险。当玩家穿梭在各个场景之间，配乐也会随之更换，让我特别记忆犹新的是当我到达夏努尔村时，配乐换成了一首非常应景的异域风情的曲目。

[h1]总结及推荐人群[/h1]

[b]优点：[/b]

❤️ 精细的CG以及过场动画

❤️ 切换恰到好处且让人心潮澎湃的配乐

❤️ 丰富的支线任务系统充实玩家的冒险之旅

❤️ 简易且流畅的操作

❤️ 详实的新手教程

[b]缺点：[/b]

💔 几乎无按键提示，并且在一些教程中玩家使用的键盘操作，但是提示中却显示的手柄按键

💔 略微粗糙的游戏建模

💔 任务指引欠缺

[b]推荐人群：[/b]

[b]情怀玩家，剧情党玩家[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047083963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1583067317}
review:
Bought it on sale, played it on normal.

Pros:
- Great bosfights
- Superb combat
- Neat little story, while not taking replacing gameplay
- Low difficulty (this can be fixed by upping the difficulty or forcing yourself to not use potions in bossfights)
- Around 20hr gameplay
- Gathering/grinding materials felt rewarding 
- Gaining levels did not make or break the game
- Great music

Cons:
- Bad graphics (it's a PSP game)
- The last boss fight might induce heavy grinding
- Low difficulty (I never lost against a single boss on normal)
- Difficulty of finding sidequests (I explored every non-secret area in the game and talked to every NPC of these areas at least once, could still only found around 50% of the sidequests)

Verdict: 9/10
This game is incredible, it basically takes most of the good things from other Ys games and puts it into Ys Seven. It gives 20hr+ of gameplay if you mostly follow the main story and read all the dialogues. However, I would not recommend to buy it unless there's a sale. 25 bucks for a PSP port feels kinda overpriced.

For Ys fans: I cannot decide if this or Ys: Origin is my favorite Ys game so far. They both did something amazing but in different ways. If you like one of them, you'll probably also like the other one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073073064', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1566271636}
review:
This game is amazing, I played this game on PSP for over hundred hours. The best part of this game is by far the OST and gameplay.

PROS:
MUSIC, really the music is fantastic.
Gameplay, fast pacing action RPG. 
Good crafting and materials system.
BOSSES. The bosses on this game are by far the best part of the gameplay. BTW this game is hard if played in the right way.

CONS:
A lot of issues with resolution.
This game can play at 4k 60fps but can also be played at like 10fps if you play on window mode at least for me. This was a big issue since the game got cropped on fullscreen. (Sometimes you can fix this with windows compatibility but not on my case.)
BUT! this is the main reason why I want to make this review. Even though I love this game. Be prepared to have a lot of issues with resolution. I couldn't played this game on my TV only on my monitor. It has a lot of cropping issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041190512', 'num_games_owned': 2467, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1562039700}
review:
PSP时代打了很久的游戏，但因为丢档遗憾止步在接近结局的地方。
作为战斗系统改革较大的一代有其不太成熟的地方，PSP时代的画面放在今天也实属感人，但总体上还是很有趣的，能接受的话推荐一玩，伊苏作为颇有些难度的ARPG，反复挑战boss从疯狂猝死到摸清套路应对的过程是非常有成就感的。
不过为了欧美式AB键位大改了手柄布局，害我手动调整了半天感到很不爽，没有日语配音也很难受，移植上这些地方多少还是有点不满。

author: {'steamid': '76561198160277860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1562387696}
review:
As an entry point of modern YS games, Seven is stellar. Even compared to the newer Celceta, I think Seven still has things it did better.

If you haven't played YS before, Seven is a good starting point. The game itself is a fast (perhaps very fast) paced action RPG. You control Adol, a red haired adventurer who eats mythical creatures and gods for breakfast who was given a quest by the king to explore Altago region. During the quest, you, as Adol, will perform a party of three out of 7 playable characters with different attacks (Slash, Strike, Pierce). Each type of attack are stronger against different kinds of enemies. Gameplay is swift, you can chain attacks with your weapon skills whenever and wherever you want. I won't talk about its story since story is never the reason you play YS games although lots of YS fans say that Seven has the best story compared to other YS. If you want a combat focused action RPG and don't want to mess around with numbers, this is a perfect purchase.

If you have played Memories of Celceta and wonder whether you should play Seven or not, the answer is yes. While Celceta has superior graphics, I can argue that Seven has a better art design. Its areas are more distinct (compared to Celceta which mainly are just forests and ruins). Seven is also a much more challenging in terms of boss battles since you are only limited to few potions. I also think it has a better boss design. This is not to bash Celceta since Celceta still plays smoother overall and its graphics is indeed far superior compared to Seven.

I only have two nitpicks: the first one is a difficulty spike between mobs and boss. The mobs are surprisingly easy you could just mash the button like a zombie and still come out unscathed. The bosses, however, require you to memorize patterns and utilize your reflex decently. It does make beating the boss a much more satisfying experience, so that's not an entirely bad thing. My second nitpick is the atrocious default control. It's hard to keep charging attacks while dodging using the default control. However, it is also a quickly resolvable issue. 

PS: I don't know if it is considered spoiler or not, but make sure to level all of your characters since there are battles that require you to use all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016859256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1632736922}
review:
One of the newer, more "modern" installments in the long running YS series. Ys is a sort of cult counterpart to Zelda, dating back to the 80's, and known for it's uniquely fast paced action and rocking soundtracks.

Unfortunately, Seven is a massive step back compared to the previous two games in the series, Ys: Origin and Ys: Oath in Felghana.

Oath and Origin merged fast paced hack and slash, platforming, and bullet hell into a manic experience where you were constantly dashing around environments, leaping over platforms and bullets, and delivering swift sword combos to foes without breaking pace. You were always on the move, always maneuvering, always dashing around. That high mobility action was what made those two games feel so unique and exciting.

Seven removes the ability to jump, and adds a "flash guard" parry type move that completely deflects all damage if timed successfully. Without jumping and platforming, dungeons turn into repetitive arena mazes and battles lose a ton of variety. The flash guard - while sometimes difficult to execute - also changes the optimal strategy for boss fights from an exciting "run all around the arena like a hyperactive madman to dodge" to a simple "stand in front of the boss without moving and parry every attack.". The optimal strategy for every boss is essentially the same now. flashguard, mash, flashguard, mash, flashguard, mash...

There's a lot of other things I could nitpick too. The party system is wonky as hell and almost every melee character plays the same (and everyone has the same movement). The laundry list of attack skills are only differentiated by the damage they do, unlike the finely tuned skill trinity from Origin/Felghana each of which had several strategic uses (i-frames, range, aoe, aerial maneuvering, etc.), the non-boss enemies are pathetically easy punching bags and all nearly identical in their attack patterns, etc. etc.

That being said, YS Seven is not a bad game, and I can't bring myself to give it a thumbs down. It's well crafted for what it is, and a perfectly fun and flashy little hack and slash if you turn your brain off and button mash through it. It has the typical charm, earnestness, and brisk pace you'd expect from a Falcom game. But for someone like me - who's played a million billion action games since childhood and has accordingly developed extremely nitpicky and high standards for them - YS Seven is a massive, massive stepback compared to its stellar predecessors.

Go play those instead. Or again, if you already have.
